inclusion.criterion: extensive baseline testing will be completed at St. Luke's Episcopal Hospital in Houston, Texas
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: bone marrow harvested and later injected
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: processed cells or placebo are injected under electromechanical guidance into the affected areas of the left ventricle
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: follow-up at weeks 1 and 4, and months 3 and 6, and at one year unless there is a crossover
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: quality of life and NOGA mapping are done at the time of injection, as well as at 6 months
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: transendocardial injections of autologous bone marrow cells in patients with end-stage ischemic heart disease is safe
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: neovascularization and can improve perfusion and myocardial contractility
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: maximum of 60 patients will be enrolled in the study
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: patients with end-stage ischemic heart disease
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Canadian cardiovascular (CV) Class II-IV angina and/or congestive heart failure (CHF) symptoms
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Ejection fraction less than or equal to 45%
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Age less than 18 or greater than 70
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: History of cancer in last 5 years
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: HIV positive; hepatitis B or C positive.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Left ventricular wall thickness less than 8 mm
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Recent heart attack within the last 30 days
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: The patient is a 15 year old girl with recurrent bilateral headache. She has migraine headache and is under treatment.
